text:
ChatGPT is declining.

Switch to (better) AI, with these prompts:

1. Claude 4.5-Opus to write.
2. Grok-4.1-Thinking to search.
3. Gemini (Nano+Veo) for images and videos.
4. Use this prompt guide: https://lnkd.in/dUFKX9jg.

1. Claude 4.5-Opus to write.

☑ Use custom styles.
☑ Search before writing.
☑ Here's a prompt example:

Prompt: "Act as my newsletter research lead for “How to AI” (180K+ subscribers on Substack). Your job: find my next Sunday newsletter topic.
What performs well for my audience:
Counterintuitive AI findings (e.g., my hit “Rude” — an arxiv paper showing rudeness improves ChatGPT outputs)
Major product launches the week they drop (ChatGPT-5, new Claude features, etc.)
Practical “hidden feature” deep-dives
Contrarian takes backed by data
Your research plan:
Search this week’s AI news for anything with viral potential
Check arxiv.org for recent AI/LLM papers with surprising or counterintuitive findings
Look for underreported announcements from OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Meta
Scan for emerging controversies or debates in AI
Deliver 10 topic + angle combinations: For each, give me:
Topic (2-5 words)
Angle (the specific hook that makes it newsletter-worthy)
Source (link)
Why it fits (one sentence on why my audience would care)
Prioritize “I didn’t know that” moments over obvious news everyone’s already covered. Start by searching now — I need fresh options, not hypotheticals."

2. Grok-4.1-Thinking to search.

☑ The only AI that can search through Twitter.
☑ The most accurate AI to find relevant news.
☑ Here's a prompt example (but I found many more here: https://lnkd.in/dUFKX9jg).

Prompt: “Act as a public opinion researcher. Your goal is to gauge polarized views on a hot-button issue, defining success as categorizing 30+ X posts into pro/con/neutral buckets with engagement metrics, backed by web snippets for context. Employ X semantic search with a query like ‘debate on [topic]’ excluding biased sources, and web search with snippets for ‘site:reddit.com [topic] OR site:news.com [topic]’.”
